result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Travis J. Hawpetoss was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for time served since 3/6/2015
Eligible for Substance Abuse program after 8/6/2015.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and costs due immediately - run concurrent with prison sentence.
Cost due immediate and run concurrent with prison sentence.

Absolute sobriety - no class B establishments.
Employment totalling at least 32 hours per week or 5 job searches per week.
SCRAM or other monitor as determined by agent.
AODA and followthrough.
No driving w/o a valid driver's license.
Give DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis J. Hawpetoss

defendant.name: Hawpetoss, Travis J.
defendant.address: W606 Joe Johnson Rd, Suring, WI 54174

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petition for Interlock Exemption Due to Hardship
Successfully completed ERP and DOC to modify sentence accordingly.
Transcript of Plea and Sentencing held on May 5, 2015

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews a plea questionnaire.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty of count 1.  Court 2 dismissed.  Remarks by Atty. Parker and Atty. Haacke regarding joint recommendation.  Defendant makes a short statement.

Court pronounces sentence:  Eligible for Substance abuse program after 8/6/2015.  18 mo. prison + 24 months extended supervision.  $3,976.00 fine & costs.  3 year license revocation and IID.  $50.00 blood draw fee, $20 warrant fee.  Conditions of extended supervision.  Absolute sobriety, no class B establishments, full-time employment of 32 hours total per week or 5 job searches per week, SCRAM or other monitor, AODA and followthrough, no driving w/o valid license.  Give DNA sample.  Credit for time served since 3/6/2015.

Appeal rights given.

Certified driver's record will be filed post-conviction.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: from DA to Atty Haacke re: Discovery

Court accepts waiver and binds matter over for immediate arraignment.    Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to the information which was submitted by the DA.  Attny Haacke argues for a reduction in bond.  DA objects.  Bond will remain at $2,500.00 cash.

Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a preliminary hearing.  Defense requests modification of bond.  Remarks by Atty. Haacke.  Response by Atty. Niemi.  Court does not change bond.

Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss in court, in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant reports on attorney.  May now qualify for public defender.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss not in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant talks about his time trying to get counsel.  Court continues one week.  Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss in court, in custody.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Defendant states he does not qualify for public defender, but has talked to other counsel.  Defendant would like a bond reduction.  Court will take that under advisement next week.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Absolute sobriety.  No entry into Class B licensed establishment serving alcohol.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.
Defendant Travis J. Hawpetoss appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Scott E. Niemi appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
